item.title: Samsung SDI to Sell $1.4 Billion New Shares for Battery Plants
item.description: Samsung SDI Co. will raise 2 trillion won ($1.4 billion) selling new shares to fund investments in US and European facilities as well as new technologies, as the battery maker bets on long-term growth of the electric-car industry.

item.title: Citi Sued by More Ex-Sales Traders Over 2019 Hong Kong Firing
item.description: Three former Citigroup Inc. equity sales traders filed wrongful termination claims against the US bank in Hong Kong this month, after a court in the city ruled that one of their ex-colleagues shouldn’t have been summarily dismissed in 2019.

item.title: Shein Remains Committed to IPO as Firm Weathers US Tariff Storm
item.description: Shein’s executive chairman said he remains committed to plans to take the fast-fashion retailer public despite being in the cross hairs of President Donald Trump’s campaign to rebalance global trade.

item.title: Oil Pares Weekly Loss as US Sanctions Offset Bleak IEA Outlook
item.description: Oil rose as fresh US sanctions against Iranian oil and shipping countered some of Thursday’s slump following a dour demand forecast from the IEA.

item.title: Crown Castle Sells Its Fiber Business for Combined $8.5 Billion
item.description: Telecommunications company Crown Castle Inc. has reached an agreement with an EQT AB fund and Zayo Group Holdings Inc. for each to buy separate parts of its fiber business for a combined value of $8.5 billion.

item.title: China Is ‘Laughing’ at US Trade Wars, EU Top Diplomat Says
item.description: China stands to gain from the ongoing trade wars between the US and its allies, the European Union’s foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas said in an interview with Bloomberg Television.

item.title: Peru Holds Key Rate as Policymakers Gauge Trade War Impact
item.description: Peru left interest rates unchanged on Thursday as policymakers try to gauge the inflationary impact of global trade wars.

item.title: CATL Shares Trail Most EV Battery Peers Ahead of Earnings Report
item.description: Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. reports earnings details Friday that may provide useful clues for investors after its stock’s underperformance versus most electric-vehicle battery rivals this year.

item.title: Gold Hits Fresh Record as US Economic Fears Stoke Haven Demand
item.description: Gold rose to a record as President Donald Trump’s aggressive tariff agenda and a weak inflation report fanned fears about the outlook for US growth, driving investors to scoop up safer assets.

item.title: Asian Stocks to Fall as S&P Slides Into Correction: Markets Wrap
item.description: Asian equities faced downward pressure at the open on Friday after US stocks fell past a key milestone, weighed down by US President Donald Trump’s trade war.

item.title: China’s Bond Market Is Changing Its Tune on Japanification
item.description: Just a few months after China’s bond market was plagued by fears of Japanification, soaring yields are pointing to a stark shift in sentiment.

item.title: AIA to Buyback $1.6 Billion, New Business Value Misses Estimates
item.description: AIA Group Ltd. said it will start a $1.6 billion share buyback and reported a 17% growth in new business value last year that missed analyst estimates.

item.title: Stock Turmoil Spreads as Fear Hits the World of Corporate Bonds
item.description: As stocks stumbled in recent weeks, a cohort of Wall Street pros took solace as credit markets held firm and economic data proved benign.

item.title: DHS Workers Tasked With Curbing Hacks Ousted in DOGE Squeeze
item.description: Cybersecurity experts who worked to secure US government computers from Russian and Chinese hackers have been ousted from their roles following pressure from Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency, according to two people familiar with the matter.

item.title: Nintendo Switch 2 Set for Gaming’s Biggest Ever Launch Even at $400-Plus
item.description: Investors are betting on Nintendo Co. delivering the biggest launch in game industry history with its Switch 2, and analysts see it selling rapidly even with a higher price than its predecessor.

item.title: UK, US Hold Private Talks in Bid to Calm Apple Encryption Feud
item.description: British officials have held private talks with their US counterparts in an attempt to resolve concerns that the UK is trying to force Apple Inc. to build a backdoor into Americans’ encrypted data, according to people familiar with the matter.

item.title: Japan’s Key Union to Unveil Wage Deals Closely Watched by BOJ
item.description: Japan’s largest trade union federation is set to announce its first tally of pay deals, a crucial measure of whether wage growth momentum is holding up in the country. Worker pay remains an essential piece of the virtuous economic cycle sought by the Bank of Japan and the government.

item.title: Tinder Owner’s New CEO Signals Urgency to Rebuild User Trust
item.description: Match Group Inc. will “streamline operations,” invest in growth areas and set up a confidential channel for its employees to share ideas with the executive team to improve its dating apps, said the company’s newly appointed chief executive officer charged with executing on a turnaround.

item.title: 美国联邦政府申请失业救济人数连续第三周居高不下
item.description: 由于特朗普政府继续解雇美国各机构的工作人员，联邦雇员的失业救济申请仍处于高位。【原文：Applications for unemployment benefits filed by federal employees remained at an elevated level as the Trump administration continued to terminate workers across US agencies.】

item.title: 在房利未来备受质疑之际，普尔特被确认将领导 FHFA
item.description: 参议院多数议员支持比尔-普尔特担任联邦住房金融局局长，他领导的联邦住房金融局通过监督房利美和房地美，在美国住房市场中发挥着关键作用。【原文：Bill Pulte was confirmed as director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency after a majority of the Senate backed him to lead an agency that plays a key role in the US housing market through its oversight of Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac.】

item.title: 布洛克子公司获得 FDIC 现金 App 借款贷款批准
item.description: 布洛克公司（Block Inc.）表示，其工业银行子公司 Square Financial Services 已获得美国联邦存款保险公司批准，开始通过其 Cash App Borrow 产品直接提供消费贷款。【原文：Block Inc. said its Square Financial Services industrial bank subsidiary received approval from the US Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. to begin offering consumer loans directly through its Cash App Borrow product.】

item.title: Kuwait Cabinet Approves Debt Law, Paving Way for Bond Sales
item.description: Kuwait’s Council of Ministers approved a draft decree that paves the way for the OPEC-member Gulf state to sell debt for the first time in eight years.

item.title: 苹果计划推出可实时翻译对话的 AirPods 功能
item.description: 据知情人士透露，苹果公司正在计划推出一项新的 AirPods 功能，允许耳塞将人机对话实时翻译成另一种语言。【原文：Apple Inc. is planning a new AirPods feature that allows the earbuds to live-translate an in-person conversation into another language, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 中国批准即将到期，美国肉类出口面临风险
item.description: 由于数百家向中国发货的美国肉类加工厂的出口资格将于下周到期，超过 30 亿美元的美国牛肉、猪肉和家禽出口可能因此中断。【原文：More than $3 billion in US beef, pork and poultry exports could be disrupted as eligibility is set to expire next week for hundreds of American meat plants that ship to China.】

item.title: 法国央行行长称特朗普的经济政策是一场 "悲剧
item.description: 法国央行行长抨击唐纳德-特朗普的政策是世界最大经济体的 "悲剧"，在美国总统的贸易战席卷欧洲之际，他加大了对美国总统的批评力度。【原文：France’s central bank chief slammed Donald Trump’s policies as a “tragedy” for the world’s largest economy, ramping up criticism of the US president as his trade war engulfs Europe.】

item.title: 经济风险加剧，摩根士丹利黯淡的美元前景更加暗淡
item.description: 摩根士丹利公司（Morgan Stanley & Co.）认为，随着对经济健康状况的担忧加剧，美元将面临更多麻烦。【原文：The dollar is already having its worst start to a year since the global financial crisis triggered a US recession, and Morgan Stanley & Co. sees more trouble ahead for the currency as fears about the health of the economy grow.】

item.title: AvidXchange Said to Weigh Sale After Takeover Interest
item.description: AvidXchange Holdings Inc., a financial technology company that helps midsize businesses pay and receive bills, is weighing a sale after getting takeover interest, according to people familiar with the matter.
